service_domains.definition: A collection of service domain responsible for handling various aspects of banking account operations

elements.name: Account
elements.description: Container for records associated with a business arrangement for regular transactions and services

elements.name: Account As An Asset
elements.description: Financial asset in the form of an account

elements.name: Account Holder
elements.description: Party that owns an account

elements.name: Account Identifier
elements.description: Identifier that denotes an account

elements.name: Account Ownership
elements.description: Holding of an account

elements.name: Account Provider
elements.description: Party that provides and services an account

elements.name: Account Specific Service Agreement
elements.description: Service-agreement that is account-specific, applicable in cases where a client might hold multiple accounts with differing terms and conditions

elements.name: Account Statement
elements.description: Periodic summary of account activity for a given period of time

elements.name: Accounting Transaction
elements.description: Event recognized by an entry in the records of an account

elements.name: applies To Account
elements.description: Indicates the account to which the transaction record or individual transaction applies

elements.name: Balance
elements.description: Amount of money available or owed

elements.name: Bank Account Identifier
elements.description: Identifier that identifies a demand deposit account provided by a bank

elements.name: Basic Bank Account Identifier
elements.description: Identifier that uniquely identifies an individual account at a specific financial institution in a particular country and which includes a bank identifier of the financial institution servicing that account

elements.name: Cash Account
elements.description: An investment account where all transactions must be settled with cash in the account, as opposed to a margin account

elements.name: Client Account
elements.description: An account held by a service provider on behalf of a client to manage their assets or transactions

elements.name: Demand Deposit
elements.description: A bank account (like a checking account) from which funds can be withdrawn at any time without advance notice

elements.name: Deposit Account
elements.description: An account held at a financial institution where funds are placed for safekeeping and can be withdrawn under certain conditions

elements.name: Account Change Notification Obligation
elements.description: Obligation to notify a counterparty of any changes in account details

service_domains.definition: The domain governs the full lifecycle of customer engagement, including onboarding, relationship development and eventual closure

elements.name: Adult
elements.description: Person who has attained the age of majority as defined in some jurisdiction

elements.name: Age
elements.description: Length of time that something or someone has been alive or existed

elements.name: Age Of Majority
elements.description: Age at which someone acquires the rights and responsibilities of an adult in some jurisdiction

elements.name: Agent For Service Of Process
elements.description: Registered agent (person or organization) designated by a business entity, such as a corporation, to receive legal correspondence on behalf of the business entity in the jurisdiction in which the agent's address is located

elements.name: Authorized Party
elements.description: Party that has been given the responsibility to act on behalf of another party under some set of guidelines

elements.name: Beneficial Owner
elements.description: Party that enjoys the benefits of ownership (such as receipt of income) of something even though its ownership (title) may be in the name of another party (called a nominee or registered owner)

elements.name: Beneficiary
elements.description: Party that receives some benefit or advantage or profits from something

elements.name: Birth Certificate
elements.description: An original document certifying the circumstances of the birth, or a certified copy of or representation of the ensuing registration of that birth

elements.name: Birth Certificate Identification Scheme
elements.description: System for allocating identifiers to birth certificates

elements.name: Birth Certificate Identifier
elements.description: Identifier associated with a vital record documenting the birth of a child

elements.name: Child
elements.description: A young human being below the age of full legal responsibility

elements.name: Citizenship
elements.description: The status of being a legally recognized member of a country, state, or commonwealth

elements.name: Client
elements.description: A party that purchases goods or services from another party

elements.name: Consumer
elements.description: A party that purchases goods and services for personal use rather than for manufacture or resale

elements.name: Customer
elements.description: A party who receives a service or product from a seller or service provider

elements.name: Date Of Birth
elements.description: The day, month, and year a person was born

elements.name: Dependent Child
elements.description: A child who relies on another person (parent or guardian) for financial support

elements.name: Business Address
elements.description: A specific location where a business is conducted or where legal correspondence and official documents can be delivered

elements.name: Business Entity
elements.description: An organization formed to conduct business, engage in commerce, or carry out a mission, whether for-profit or not-for-profit

elements.name: Business Identifier
elements.description: A unique code or number assigned to a legal entity to identify it in various business or legal contexts

elements.name: Business Legal Name
elements.description: The official and registered full name of a business entity

elements.name: Address
elements.description: Index to a location to which communications may be delivered

elements.name: Address Component
elements.description: Aspect of an address

elements.name: Addressing Scheme
elements.description: System for allocating addresses to objects

elements.name: advises
elements.description: Provides counsel or guidance to

elements.name: Communication Address
elements.description: An address used for transmitting information, which can be physical (postal) or electronic (email)

elements.name: Communication Channel
elements.description: The medium or pathway through which information is transmitted from a sender to a receiver

elements.name: Complaint
elements.description: A formal statement alleging a grievance or wrong, typically filed with a regulatory body or in a court of law

elements.name: Consent
elements.description: A voluntary agreement to a proposition or action

elements.name: Contact Information
elements.description: Data used to communicate with a party, such as a phone number, email address, or postal address

elements.name: Contact Point
elements.description: A specific individual or department designated for communication within an organization

service_domains.definition: This domain is responsible for the servicing and administration of loan agreements throughout their lifecycles

elements.name: Accrued Interest
elements.description: Amount of interest that has been incurred, as of a specific date, on a loan or other financial obligation but has not yet been paid out

elements.name: Administrative Agent
elements.description: Role of a financial institution (often one of the primary lenders in the syndicate) designated to act as an intermediary between the borrowers and the syndicate lenders

elements.name: Agency Agreement
elements.description: Agreement that designates a party as a registered agent to represent and act on behalf of another

elements.name: Agreement
elements.description: Negotiated understanding between two or more parties, reflecting the offer and acceptance of commitments on the part of either party

elements.name: Amortization
elements.description: The process of reduction of debt or other costs through periodic charges to assets or liabilities, such as through principal payments on mortgages

elements.name: Amortization Schedule
elements.description: Schedule of periodic payments (repayment installments) that specify changes in the balance of the debt over time

elements.name: Appraisal
elements.description: Written estimate of the market value of something as of some point in time, typically provided by a qualified appraiser

elements.name: Appraised Value
elements.description: Estimated value of some asset as of a given point in time

elements.name: Appraiser
elements.description: Party that evaluates or estimates the nature, quality, ability, or value of someone or something

elements.name: Base Rate
elements.description: Basic rate of interest on which the actual rate a bank charges on loans to its customers is calculated

elements.name: Closed-End Mortgage
elements.description: A mortgage agreement that prevents the borrower from taking out additional funds against the property

elements.name: Collateral
elements.description: An asset or property pledged by a borrower to a lender to secure a loan; it may be seized by the lender if the borrower defaults

elements.name: Collateral Agreement
elements.description: A legal contract documenting the terms under which collateral is provided to secure a financial obligation

elements.name: Conventional Mortgage
elements.description: A home loan that is not guaranteed or insured by a government agency like the FHA or VA

elements.name: Covenant
elements.description: A formal agreement or promise, often legally binding, included in a loan or bond agreement

elements.name: Credit Facility
elements.description: A type of loan or financing arrangement that allows a business to borrow funds up to a certain limit

elements.name: Credit Rating
elements.description: An assessment of the creditworthiness of a borrower in general or with respect to a specific debt or financial obligation

elements.name: Credit Risk
elements.description: The potential that a borrower will default on a debt obligation

elements.name: Absolute Prepayment Rate
elements.description: Measure of the monthly rate of loan prepayments as a percentage of the original pool balance

elements.name: Accrual
elements.description: The process of accumulating interest or other income that has been earned but not paid

elements.name: Auto Asset Backed Security
elements.description: Asset-backed security that is backed by an underlying pool of auto-related loans and/or leases

elements.name: Auto Debt Pool
elements.description: Debt pool of loans and/or leases that are motor vehicle-related

elements.name: Debt
elements.description: An obligation that requires one party (the debtor) to pay money or transfer other agreed-upon value to another party (the creditor)

elements.name: Debt Obligation
elements.description: A specific requirement to repay a debt, often defined by a schedule and set of terms

elements.name: Debt Pool
elements.description: A collection of various debt instruments grouped together, often used as the underlying assets for a structured finance product

elements.name: Debtor
elements.description: The party that owes a debt or is under a financial obligation to another party

elements.name: Default
elements.description: A failure to meet the legal obligations (or terms) of a loan, such as when a borrower fails to make a required interest or principal payment

elements.name: Default Risk
elements.description: The risk of loss due to a debtor's failure to repay a loan or meet contractual obligations

elements.name: Disbursement
elements.description: The action of paying out money

elements.name: Collection Agency
elements.description: A business that specializes in collecting debts for creditors

service_domains.definition: Orchestrating the investment and rebalancing of an investment portfolio to optimize gains while remaining within the terms of portfolio charter or agreement

elements.name: Annualized Standard Deviation
elements.description: Standard deviation for some measure over a specific reference period

elements.name: applies Methodology
elements.description: Indicates the strategy used for the purposes of determining the fair market or present value of something

elements.name: Arithmetic Mean
elements.description: Sum of a collection of numbers divided by the number of numbers in the collection

elements.name: Assessment Activity
elements.description: Activity involving the evaluation or estimation of the nature, quality, ability, or value of someone or something

elements.name: Assessment Event
elements.description: Event involving the evaluation or estimation of the nature, quality, or ability of someone or something

elements.name: Assessment Report
elements.description: Report that includes an opinion, judgement, appraisal, or view about something and typically the methodology and raw inputs used to arrive at that opinion

elements.name: Asset
elements.description: Something of monetary value that is owned or provides benefit to some party

elements.name: Asset Class
elements.description: Financial instrument classifier for a group of securities that exhibit similar characteristics, behave similarly in the marketplace and are subject to the same laws and regulations

elements.name: Average Absolute Deviation
elements.description: Average of the absolute deviations from a central point

elements.name: Basket
elements.description: Collection of goods, services, or other things (e.g., financial contracts) that can be purchased and sold in some marketplace

elements.name: Basket Constituent
elements.description: Component of a basket

elements.name: Basket Of Commodities
elements.description: Custom basket whose constituents consist of one or more negotiable commodities

elements.name: Basket Of Debt Instruments
elements.description: Basket of securities whose constituents are debt instruments

elements.name: Basket Of Equities
elements.description: Basket of securities whose constituents are listed shares

elements.name: Basket Of Indices
elements.description: Basket composed of market indices

elements.name: Basket Of Securities
elements.description: Basket composed of securities, typically of a particular asset class such as equities or bonds

elements.name: Composite Index
elements.description: A market index that is constructed by combining the components of several other indices

elements.name: Counterparty Credit Risk
elements.description: The risk that a counterparty to a financial transaction will default on its obligations

elements.name: Custodian
elements.description: A financial institution that holds a customer's securities for safekeeping to minimize the risk of theft or loss

elements.name: Custodian Bank
elements.description: A bank specializing in acting as a custodian for investment funds and institutional investors

elements.name: Custody Agreement
elements.description: A legal contract that defines the terms under which a custodian will hold and manage a client's assets

elements.name: Budget
elements.description: Financial plan for a defined period, typically a year, that describes how resources will be allocated and spent

elements.name: Budgetary Allocation
elements.description: Amount of funds assigned to a specific purpose or activity within a budget

elements.name: Budgetary Component
elements.description: A portion or sub-category within a financial budget, used for allocation and tracking

elements.name: Capital
elements.description: Financial assets, funds, or resources available for use in a business or project

elements.name: Capital Adequacy
elements.description: The amount of capital a bank or other financial institution holds relative to its risk-weighted assets to ensure its financial stability

elements.name: Capital Asset
elements.description: An asset with a useful life of more than one year that is not intended for sale in the regular course of the business's operation

elements.name: Capital Requirement
elements.description: The minimum amount of capital that financial institutions are required to hold by regulatory authorities

elements.name: Concentration Limit
elements.description: A constraint imposed on the maximum exposure an entity can have to a single counterparty, industry, or asset class to mitigate risk

elements.name: Contingency Plan
elements.description: A plan designed to take a possible future event or circumstance into account, especially a plan B for a possible disaster

elements.name: Aligned Community Investment Fund
elements.description: Community investment fund that raises capital publicly from community members and deploys some of that capital via investments into its client businesses or other businesses in the community

elements.name: Close-End Fund
elements.description: A type of mutual fund that issues a fixed number of shares via an IPO and then trades them on a stock exchange

service_domains.definition: Trade Finance covers a broad range of financing, guarantee and transaction processing services. This service domain handles the fulfilment of a flexible line of credit provided to a customer active in import/export business to provide them access to trade-related financing

elements.name: Bill Of Exchange
elements.description: Short-term negotiable financial instrument consisting of an order in writing addressed by one person (the seller of goods) to another (the buyer), requiring the latter to pay a fixed amount of money on demand (a sight draft) or on a predetermined date (a time draft)

elements.name: Commercial Paper
elements.description: A short-term, unsecured debt instrument issued by large corporations to raise funds to meet short-term liabilities

elements.name: Bankers Acceptance
elements.description: Short-term debt instrument that is guaranteed and paid by a bank and used as a relatively safe form of payment for large transactions

elements.name: Certificate
elements.description: A document attesting to a fact, qualification, or promise

elements.name: Certified Document
elements.description: A copy of a document that is formally guaranteed to be a true and accurate copy of the original

elements.name: Document
elements.description: A written or electronic record that contains official or factual information

elements.name: Deed
elements.description: A legal document that is signed and delivered, especially one regarding the ownership of property or legal rights

service_domains.definition: Initiating, validating and executing payment transactions for both consumers and business customers. This includes domestic and international transfers, single and recurring payments, and orchestration of payment instructions.

elements.name: Amount Of Money
elements.description: Amount of readily available cash in banknotes and coins

elements.name: Bank Identifier
elements.description: Identifier that uniquely identifies the financial institution and, when appropriate, the branch of that financial institution servicing an account

elements.name: Book Entry Settlement
elements.description: Settlement in which all transactions are processed via electronic book entries rather than the physical exchange of security certificates or other documentation

elements.name: Cash
elements.description: Currency (banknotes and coins) held by an individual or organization, or money available in a bank account

elements.name: Cash Deposit
elements.description: The act of placing cash into a bank account or similar financial holding

elements.name: Cash Settlement
elements.description: The process of settling a financial contract, such as a derivative, with a net cash payment rather than the physical delivery of the underlying asset

elements.name: Clearing House
elements.description: A financial institution that acts as an intermediary and assumes the role of matching and guaranteeing trades between a buyer and a seller

elements.name: Central Counterparty
elements.description: An entity that interposes itself between counterparties to contracts traded in one or more financial markets, becoming the buyer to every seller and the seller to every buyer

elements.name: Counterparty
elements.description: A party involved in a financial transaction

elements.name: Currency
elements.description: A medium of exchange, such as banknotes and coins, typically issued by a government

elements.name: Currency Exchange Rate
elements.description: The rate at which one currency will be exchanged for another

elements.name: Currency Pair
elements.description: A quotation of the exchange rate for two different currencies, such as EUR/USD

elements.name: Accounting Framework
elements.description: Framework, including policies, methods, rules, and processes, used to measure, recognize, present, and disclose the information appearing in an entity's financial statements

elements.name: Accounting Transaction
elements.description: Event recognized by an entry in the records of an account

elements.name: Bilateral Netting Provision
elements.description: Netting provision that occurs between two parties, in which mutual obligations are offset to determine a single net payment

elements.name: Close-Out Netting
elements.description: A provision in a master agreement that requires all obligations between two parties to be netted to a single, final payment upon a default or termination event

elements.name: Banking Product
elements.description: Product provided to consumers and businesses by a depository institution

elements.name: Banking Service
elements.description: Financial service offered by a depository institution

elements.name: Basket Certificate
elements.description: Certificate whose underlying asset represents a fraction of a basket of securities that corresponds to the subscription ratio

elements.name: Bond
elements.description: Tradable debt instrument representing a loan in which the issuer owes the holder(s) a debt

elements.name: Bond Amortization Payment Terms
elements.description: Terms that include a schedule for repayment of the principal over the lifetime of the bond, typically in equal payments at regular intervals

elements.name: Bond Conversion Terms
elements.description: Terms indicating when a convertible bond can be converted to another security (usually a publicly traded share issued by of the same issuer)

elements.name: Bond Coupon
elements.description: Interest rate on a debt security that the issuer promises to pay to the holder until maturity, expressed as an annual percentage of the face value

elements.name: Bond Principal Repayment Terms
elements.description: Terms for the repayment of the principal on a bond

elements.name: Bond Variable Coupon
elements.description: Bond coupon that has a variable interest rate

elements.name: Callable Bond
elements.description: A bond that the issuer may redeem before its stated maturity date

elements.name: Capital Instrument
elements.description: A financial security issued by a company to raise capital, such as common stock, preferred stock, or bonds

elements.name: Certificate Of Deposit
elements.description: A time deposit that earns a specified interest rate over a fixed period and is typically issued by a bank

elements.name: Common Stock
elements.description: A security that represents ownership in a corporation; holders typically have voting rights and are entitled to a share of the company's profits

elements.name: Convertible Bond
elements.description: A bond that can be converted into a predetermined amount of the issuer's common stock at the holder's option

elements.name: Convertible Preferred Stock
elements.description: Preferred stock that includes an option for the holder to convert it into a fixed number of common shares

elements.name: Adjustable Rate Dividend
elements.description: Dividend that varies with a benchmark

elements.name: Amortizing Bond
elements.description: Bond that regularly pays down the principal (face value) on the debt along with its interest expense over the life of the bond

elements.name: Barrier Capital Protection Certificate
elements.description: Capital-protected product whose protection is defined as a percentage of the nominal price (e.g. 100 percent), with minimum redemption at expiry equivalent to the capital protection

elements.name: Capital Protection Certificate
elements.description: An investment product designed to provide a guaranteed return of the principal amount invested (or a large percentage of it) at maturity

elements.name: Asset Backed Security
elements.description: Debt instrument backed by receivables other than those arising out of real estate loans or mortgages

elements.name: Basket Future
elements.description: Futures contract whose underlying asset is a basket of securities and/or indices

elements.name: Basket Option
elements.description: Option whose underlying asset is a group, or basket, of commodities, securities, indices, or currencies

elements.name: Basket Warrant
elements.description: Warrant that permits the holder to acquire a package or group of assets at a specified price during a specified period

elements.name: Bond Future
elements.description: Futures contract whose underlying asset is at least one bond

elements.name: Bond Option
elements.description: Option giving the buyer (holder) the right, but not the obligation, to buy or sell (depending on whether it is a call or a put) a bond at a certain price on or before a specified date

elements.name: Bond Pool
elements.description: Debt pool of consisting of bonds

elements.name: Call Option
elements.description: An option contract that gives the holder the right, but not the obligation, to buy an underlying asset at a specified price (strike price) on or before a specified date (expiration date)

elements.name: Collateralized Debt Obligation
elements.description: A complex structured finance product backed by a pool of assets, such as loans, bonds, or other debt instruments

elements.name: Collateralized Loan Obligation
elements.description: A type of CDO that is backed by a pool of corporate loans

elements.name: Commodity Futures Contract
elements.description: A futures contract where the underlying asset is a physical commodity

elements.name: Commodity Option
elements.description: An option contract where the underlying asset is a commodity or a commodity future

elements.name: Corporate Bond
elements.description: A debt security issued by a corporation to raise capital

elements.name: Credit Default Swap
elements.description: A financial derivative that allows one party to swap the credit risk of a reference entity with another party

elements.name: Currency Swap
elements.description: A swap in which the two parties exchange principal and interest payments in different currencies

elements.name: Debt Instrument
elements.description: A financial security representing a loan that an issuer must repay to the holder

elements.name: Debt Security
elements.description: A fungible, negotiable financial instrument representing a debt

elements.name: Derivative
elements.description: A financial instrument whose value is derived from an underlying asset, rate, or index

elements.name: Derivative Contract
elements.description: A legal agreement that defines the terms of a derivative transaction
